trans-unit.source: How to: Modify the Service Bus Connectivity Settings
trans-unit.target: How to: Modify the Service Bus Connectivity Settings

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectivitySettings</codeEntityReference> class contains settings that affect all endpoints, based on the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetOnewayRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetEventRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> bindings, that are active in the current application domain.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectivitySettings</codeEntityReference> class contains settings that affect all endpoints, based on the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetOnewayRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetEventRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> bindings, that are active in the current application domain.

trans-unit.source: The reason for the shared nature of these settings is that the connectivity path to <token>sb2</token> is identical across all endpoints in the same process.
trans-unit.target: The reason for the shared nature of these settings is that the connectivity path to <token>sb2</token> is identical across all endpoints in the same process.

trans-unit.source: Most corporate network environments prefer to limit ports opened to outbound traffic, and typically restrict outbound HTTP and TCP traffic to the same narrow range of ports.
trans-unit.target: Most corporate network environments prefer to limit ports opened to outbound traffic, and typically restrict outbound HTTP and TCP traffic to the same narrow range of ports.

trans-unit.source: By default, all service endpoints listening for messages using one of these two bindings connect to <token>sb2</token> using outbound TCP port 9351 or 9552.
trans-unit.target: By default, all service endpoints listening for messages using one of these two bindings connect to <token>sb2</token> using outbound TCP port 9351 or 9552.

trans-unit.source: If neither of these ports is available for outbound communication, you can set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.SystemConnectivity</codeEntityReference> property of the connectivity settings to <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectivityMode.Http</codeEntityReference>, which enables the HTTP polling through outbound ports 80 and 443 using RFC 2616-compliant HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: If neither of these ports is available for outbound communication, you can set the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.SystemConnectivity</codeEntityReference> property of the connectivity settings to <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectivityMode.Http</codeEntityReference>, which enables the HTTP polling through outbound ports 80 and 443 using RFC 2616-compliant HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: RFC 2616 strongly recommends constraining the concurrent requests to a particular domain be limited to two, and the operating system and networking devices or upstream proxies can enforce that limit.
trans-unit.target: RFC 2616 strongly recommends constraining the concurrent requests to a particular domain be limited to two, and the operating system and networking devices or upstream proxies can enforce that limit.

trans-unit.source: Considering that, the HTTP polling mode is using a single HTTP connection to implement polling.
trans-unit.target: Considering that, the HTTP polling mode is using a single HTTP connection to implement polling.

trans-unit.source: All messages destined for all one-way and event endpoints in the current application domain are multiplexed through the HTTP polling connection and distributed locally.
trans-unit.target: All messages destined for all one-way and event endpoints in the current application domain are multiplexed through the HTTP polling connection and distributed locally.

trans-unit.source: To set or modify Service Bus connectivity settings
trans-unit.target: To set or modify Service Bus connectivity settings

trans-unit.source: You can set or modify the connectivity settings with the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.SystemConnectivity</codeEntityReference> property.
trans-unit.target: You can set or modify the connectivity settings with the <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.SystemConnectivity</codeEntityReference> property.

trans-unit.source: The following example, taken from the <ui>Echo</ui> <token>sb2</token> sample, shows how to set the connectivity mode in a command-line application.
trans-unit.target: The following example, taken from the <ui>Echo</ui> <token>sb2</token> sample, shows how to set the connectivity mode in a command-line application.
